ClsC_33e3e879.class_description: Concepts and actors central to democratic governance, where non-elite citizens exercise power to demand responsibility from those in authority.
ClsC_33e3e879.evidence_excerpt: the power of ordinary people to challenge injustice, demand accountability, and shape the course of history

members.entity_description: Expectation that those in power are held responsible for their actions and decisions.
members.resolution_context: They serve as a reminder of the power of ordinary people to challenge injustice, demand accountability, and shape the course of history.

members.entity_description: Non-elite individuals in general, whose collective actions can influence politics and society.
members.resolution_context: They serve as a reminder of the power of ordinary people to challenge injustice, demand accountability, and shape the course of history.

ClsC_d390bda1.class_description: Political systems and actors characterized by authoritarian or external control over populations, including oppressive regimes, long-entrenched dictators, and colonial rule.
ClsC_d390bda1.evidence_excerpt: oppressive regimes... long-standing dictators... independence from colonial rule

members.entity_description: Authoritarian or unjust governments targeted by protests and revolutions.
members.resolution_context: From ancient times to the present day, people have taken to the streets, organized strikes, and waged revolutions to challenge oppressive regimes, demand political rights, and fight for social justice.

members.entity_description: Authoritarian leaders who had held power for extended periods in affected countries.
members.resolution_context: The Arab Spring, which began in 2010 with protests in Tunisia and spread across the Middle East and North Africa, led to the overthrow of long-standing dictators and sparked hopes for democratic change in the region.

members.entity_description: System of governance where a foreign colonial power controls a territory and its people.
members.resolution_context: The American Revolution of 1776 marked a turning point in the history of protests and revolutions, as it inspired people around the world to fight for their freedom and independence from colonial rule.

ClsC_9e73d028.class_description: Forms and expressions of opposition to authorities or policies, including collective actions like strikes and public demonstrations, as well as general expressions of dissent.
ClsC_9e73d028.evidence_excerpt: organized strikes... taken to the streets... suppress dissent and silence opposition

members.entity_description: Collective work stoppages used as a protest tactic.
members.resolution_context: From ancient times to the present day, people have taken to the streets, organized strikes, and waged revolutions to challenge oppressive regimes, demand political rights, and fight for social justice.

members.entity_description: Collective public actions such as taking to the streets, peaceful demonstrations, and similar gatherings used to express dissent, objection, or demands in public spaces.
members.resolution_context: All three mentions describe the same underlying concept of public protest demonstrations, differing only in phrasing or emphasis on non-violence, so they can be represented by one canonical entity.

members.entity_description: Expression of disagreement or opposition to prevailing policies or authorities.
members.resolution_context: From the Tiananmen Square massacre in China to the crackdown on pro-democracy protesters in Belarus, governments have used force to suppress dissent and silence opposition.
